author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

[noblock] Nothing wrong with this package, but it doesn't seem like something that other packages would need as a dependency. That makes it much less important to be registered: https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General#do-i-need-to-register-a-package-to-install-it

I'm just slightly skeptical that the name is so generic, as it seems more like a "personal tool" (not that others wouldn't want some motivation, too). If the name was less generic (`MotivateMarkus`, or maybe even just `MotivateMe`), I don't think it would raise any flags.

[noblock] Thanks for the comment. I agree, it is probably not a high priority package. However, I plan to build this package to include a much larger set of quotes, more options, and topics. It could be a fun tool for easter eggs in other dependencies.

I agree, that changing the name to MotivateMe is a good idea. Do I need to start the registering process all over again if I change the name?

For a name change, yes, I think so. For the earlier problem with the `compat` bound it would have been sufficient to just retrigger the existing registration to update the existing PR. But if you change the name, that'll be a new PR.
Good to know. I'll then restart the process. Thanks!

In any case: when retriggering/resubmitting the registration, you generally shouldn't change the version number. A different version number means a different PR, whereas if the package name and the version number stay the same, it'll just update the existing PR. I'd recommend using `0.1.0` for registration.

body:

title: New package: Motivate v0.0.1
